trans-unit.source: The Get All Group Memberships operation is performed by invoking the <embeddedLabel>getMemberGroups</embeddedLabel> function on a user, contact, group, or service principal.
trans-unit.target: The Get All Group Memberships operation is performed by invoking the <embeddedLabel>getMemberGroups</embeddedLabel> function on a user, contact, group, or service principal.

trans-unit.source: This function takes a single parameter that indicates whether only membership in security enabled groups or whether membership in all groups should be checked.
trans-unit.target: This function takes a single parameter that indicates whether only membership in security enabled groups or whether membership in all groups should be checked.

trans-unit.source: It returns a collection that contains the Object IDs of the groups of which the user, contact, group, or service principal is a member.
trans-unit.target: It returns a collection that contains the Object IDs of the groups of which the user, contact, group, or service principal is a member.

trans-unit.source: The operation is transitive, that is, if User A is a member of Group B and Group B is a member of Group C and the function is invoked on User A and Group C in one of the groups passed in the collection of groups to check, Group C will be in the collection returned by the function.
trans-unit.target: The operation is transitive, that is, if User A is a member of Group B and Group B is a member of Group C and the function is invoked on User A and Group C in one of the groups passed in the collection of groups to check, Group C will be in the collection returned by the function.

trans-unit.source: This is different than the <languageKeyword>isMemberOf</languageKeyword> navigation property, which returns only groups in which an entity has direct membership and cannot be filtered to return only security enabled groups.
trans-unit.target: This is different than the <languageKeyword>isMemberOf</languageKeyword> navigation property, which returns only groups in which an entity has direct membership and cannot be filtered to return only security enabled groups.

trans-unit.source: The request may be constructed as follows.
trans-unit.target: The request may be constructed as follows.

trans-unit.source: Replace <parameterReference>mytenantdomain</parameterReference> with the domain of your Azure Active Directory tenant, such as <parameterReference>contoso.onmicrosoft.com</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: Replace <parameterReference>mytenantdomain</parameterReference> with the domain of your Azure Active Directory tenant, such as <parameterReference>contoso.onmicrosoft.com</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> query string parameter is required.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> query string parameter is required.

trans-unit.source: The examples in this topic use the tenant domain to address the tenant.
trans-unit.target: The examples in this topic use the tenant domain to address the tenant.

trans-unit.source: For other ways of addressing the tenant, see <link xlink:href="5b0f3e3d-f96e-4b5b-864d-fc7c6b185097" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Addressing Aliases</link>.
trans-unit.target: For other ways of addressing the tenant, see <link xlink:href="5b0f3e3d-f96e-4b5b-864d-fc7c6b185097" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Addressing Aliases</link>.

trans-unit.source: Specify the resource set – users, contacts, groups, or serviceprincipals -- according to the entity against which the function is to be called.
trans-unit.target: Specify the resource set – users, contacts, groups, or serviceprincipals -- according to the entity against which the function is to be called.

trans-unit.source: For contacts, groups, and service principals the identifier should be an object ID; for users, it can be either the object ID or the user principal name.
trans-unit.target: For contacts, groups, and service principals the identifier should be an object ID; for users, it can be either the object ID or the user principal name.

trans-unit.source: If the <parameterReference>securityEnabledOnly</parameterReference> parameter is <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>, the maximum number of groups that can be returned is 1000; if it is <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword>, the maximum number of groups that can be returned is 4500.
trans-unit.target: If the <parameterReference>securityEnabledOnly</parameterReference> parameter is <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>, the maximum number of groups that can be returned is 1000; if it is <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword>, the maximum number of groups that can be returned is 4500.

trans-unit.source: A bearer token issued by Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: A bearer token issued by Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: See <legacyLink xlink:href="874839d9-6de6-43aa-9a5c-613b0c93247e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authentication Scenarios for Azure AD</legacyLink> for more information.
trans-unit.target: See <legacyLink xlink:href="874839d9-6de6-43aa-9a5c-613b0c93247e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authentication Scenarios for Azure AD</legacyLink> for more information.

trans-unit.source: The media type of the content in the request body.
trans-unit.target: The media type of the content in the request body.

trans-unit.source: The length of the request in bytes.
trans-unit.target: The length of the request in bytes.

trans-unit.source: The parameters to the function: <parameterReference>securityEnabledOnly</parameterReference>, a boolean that is <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword> to indicate that only security groups of which the entity is a member should be returned, or <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword> to indicate that all groups of which the entity is a member should be returned.
trans-unit.target: The parameters to the function: <parameterReference>securityEnabledOnly</parameterReference>, a boolean that is <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword> to indicate that only security groups of which the entity is a member should be returned, or <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword> to indicate that all groups of which the entity is a member should be returned.

trans-unit.source: The following sample request gets all of the groups, security enabled and otherwise, of which the user Mohamed@contoso.onmicrosoft.com is a member.
trans-unit.target: The following sample request gets all of the groups, security enabled and otherwise, of which the user Mohamed@contoso.onmicrosoft.com is a member.

trans-unit.source: A successful operation returns status code <embeddedLabel>200 OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: A successful operation returns status code <embeddedLabel>200 OK</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The identifier for the server that performed the requested operation.
trans-unit.target: The identifier for the server that performed the requested operation.

trans-unit.source: The key that identifies the current session with the directory service.
trans-unit.target: The key that identifies the current session with the directory service.

trans-unit.source: The response contains the collection of object IDs for the groups of which the user, contact, group, or service principal is a member.
trans-unit.target: The response contains the collection of object IDs for the groups of which the user, contact, group, or service principal is a member.

trans-unit.source: The following sample response is received when the sample request above is sent.
trans-unit.target: The following sample response is received when the sample request above is sent.

trans-unit.source: It returns a collection that contains the object IDs of the three groups in which the user has membership, either directly or transitively through his membership in another group.
trans-unit.target: It returns a collection that contains the object IDs of the three groups in which the user has membership, either directly or transitively through his membership in another group.
